taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek lyra , lyre, and karpos , fruit, alluding to fruit shape]

bio:treatment.discussion: Lyrocarpa xanti Brandegee (southern Baja California) is an annual with purple, spatulate petals, deltate and sparsely pubescent leaves, often reflexed fruiting pedicels, and panduriform fruits. By contrast, L. linearifolia Rollins (Isla Angel de la Guarda and San Esteban Island, Baja California) is a subshrub with brown, linear petals, linear or pinnatifid and canescent leaves, spreading fruiting pedicels, and broadly obcordate fruits.
